lines.text: The more one talks, the less the words mean.
Shouldn't love be the only truth?
For that, love would always have to be true.
Why must one always talk? Often one shouldn't talk, but live in silence.
An instant of thought can only be grasped through words.

Suddenly I don't know what to say. It happens to me a lot. I think first about whether they're the right words. But when the moment comes to speak, I can't say it. Why must one always talks? I think one should often just keep quiet, live in silence. The more one talks, the less the words mean.
We must think, and for thoughts we need words.
One cannot distinguish the thought from the words that express it.
Words should express just what one wants to say.
